baseline_groups.claim_summary: Mafia presence increases Christian Democrat (DC) vote share in Sicilian municipalities. A unit increase in Mafia1987_diff is associated with a 0.81pp increase in DC vote share, instrumented by historical Mafia presence (circa 1900).
baseline_groups.notes: Table 4, Column 6 (Full IV). Coefficient 0.809 (SE 0.269, p=0.003). N=3696, First-stage F=61.9. Municipality + Year FE with full controls (investment, socio-demographic, economic, geographic trends, church trends). Instrument: Mafia1900_diff.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Mafia presence increases construction employment share (bui_labf) in Sicilian municipalities, consistent with patronage through public works allocation.

global_notes: Paper is 'Mafia in the Ballot Box' by De Feo and De Luca (AEJ: Economic Policy). Uses 370 Sicilian municipalities over 12 parliamentary elections (1946-1992). The identification strategy exploits historical Mafia presence (1900 parliamentary inquiry) as an instrument for contemporary Mafia activity (1987 measure) interacted with a time trend. Both IV and OLS results are reported; OLS serves as a lower bound due to likely attenuation bias. The OLS baseline with investment controls (baseline/ols/DC_VV/invest) shows a negative R2 (-1.0), indicating a problematic specification -- this OLS variant is treated cautiously. The paper also tests Mafia1994 as an alternative treatment measure, decade-specific effects, and Mafia x communism interactions. Falsification tests using MSI-PRI (right-wing) vote differentials show no significant Mafia effect. There are 139 total specifications across both outcomes.
